markdown: Ryan James Potts, Ph.D., DABT 950 Reynolds Boulevard, Winston-Salem, NC 27105 Telephone: (336) 741-1930 Email: pottsr@rjrt.com _Professional Experience_ 2017-present Vice President, Product Integrity 2016-2017 Senior Director RAI Services Company, Winston-Salem, NC, USA 2012-2015 Senior Director 2010-2012 Director 2006-2010 Master Scientist 2004-2006 Senior Staff R&D Toxicologist 2001-2004 Senior R&D Toxicologist R.J. Reynolds Tobacco Company, Winston-Salem, NC, USA Currently Vice President of Product Integrity within Scientific & Regulatory Affairs. The position reports to the Senior Vice President of Scientific & Regulatory Affairs. Key responsibilities include: * Manage Product Stewardship, Nonclinical Studies, Clinical Studies, Regulatory Compliance and Quality Assurance groups. * Oversee the design of non-clinical and clinical studies conducted to support regulatory submissions. * Oversee the development of FDA regulatory submission documents for tobacco products. * Engage with the FDA and other stakeholders on pertinent scientific topics. * Lead cross-functional technical projects. 1999-2001 *Post-Doctoral Research Toxicologist* University of Vermont, Burlington, VT, USA Accountable for the design and execution of investigative toxicological studies to evaluate the pulmonary effects of cadmium and mechanisms of toxicity. 1996-1999 Ph.D. Graduate Student University of Bath, Bath, UK Thesis title: "Toxicology of the male reproductive tract; associations with smoking and antioxidants" <::attestation: Exhibit Stamp Stamped Signature: illegible PENGAD 800-631-6989 PLAINTIFF'S EXHIBIT NO. Potts 3 FOR IDENTIFICATION 11-13-18 DATE: APTR: A rectangular, slightly tilted stamp with a border, containing printed and handwritten text, positioned centrally in the image. ::> Page 1 of 6 53757 8510 Source: https://www.industrydocuments.ucsf.edu/docs/lzkho228 W200050987

Reynolds Tobacco Company, Winston-Salem, NC, USA
Currently Vice President of Product Integrity within Scientific & Regulatory Affairs. The position reports to the Senior Vice President of Scientific & Regulatory Affairs.

Key responsibilities include: * Manage Product Stewardship, Nonclinical Studies, Clinical Studies, Regulatory Compliance and Quality Assurance groups. * Oversee the design of non-clinical and clinical studies conducted to support regulatory submissions. * Oversee the development of FDA regulatory submission documents for tobacco products. * Engage with the FDA and other stakeholders on pertinent scientific topics. * Lead cross-functional technical projects.

1996-1999 Ph.D. Graduate Student University of Bath, Bath, UK Thesis title: "Toxicology of the male reproductive tract; associations with smoking and antioxidants"
